title.text: A Multimodal Dialogue System for Medical Decision Support in Virtual Reality

abstractContent.text: We present a multimodal dialogue system that allows doctors to interact with a medical decision support system in virtual reality (VR).
We integrate an interactive visu-alization of patient records and radiology image data, as well as therapy predictions.
Therapy predictions are computed in real-time using a deep learning model.

introductionContent.text: Modern hospitals and clinics rely on digital patient data.

Simply storing and retrieving patient records is not enough; in order for computer systems to provide interactive decision support, one must represent the semantics in a machine readable form using medical ontologies (.

In this paper, we present a novel real-time decision support dialogue for the medical domain, where the physician can visualize and interact with patient data in an virtual reality environment by using natural speech and hand gestures.
Our multimodal dialogue system is an extension of previous work by where we used an Oculus Rift with an integrated eye-tracker in a medical remote collaboration setting.
First, the radiologist fills out a findings form using a mobile tablet with a stylus.
The data is then transcribed in real-time using automated handwriting recognition, parsed, and represented based on medical ontologies.
Then, the doctor, or any other health professional, enters virtual reality and interacts with patient records using the multimodal dialogue system.
Through the temporal synchronization of visual and auditory events in VR, we support multisensory integration.
This way we profit from superadditivity to further enhance multisensory perception.
